chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent James Thalman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on 3 years probation, to be served concurrently with his extended supervision from Milwaukee County case sentence.   Conditions of probation: Pay restitution to Accident Fund Holdings for Inc for workers compensation benefits paid to the victim- (insured: City of Hayward) $2850.00.    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations, Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Pay court costs $518.00.   DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge which is included in the costs.   
DEF has credit for 8 days on any jail sentence later imposed.


Concurrent with: Extended supervision DE is currently on

miscConds.notes: $2850 to Accident Fund Holdings Inc., plus applicable surcharges.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$518.00 total court costs.   DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $250 surcharge.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations
$1000 bond deposit forwarded to DOC for payment of financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Fax was sent this date to the Milwaukee County House of Corrections, containing Defendant's pending case numbers and court date on 06/22/15 requesting to schedule a telephonic appearance by DE with court dialing in to their facility.  (NOTE:  THE HOUSE OF CORRECTIONS CALLED BACK TO CONFIRM RECEIPT OF THE FAX & DE WAS SET FOR HIS COURT APPEARANCE.)
A copy of the Notice of Hearing for June 22, 2015 was mailed to Defendant at:   Milwaukee County House Of Correction, 8885 South 68th Street, Franklin, WI   53132
Scheduling conference at 06-22-2015 01:30 pm
PETITION AND ORDER for Discharge of Attorney
Scheduling conference at 06-16-2015 01:30 pm
Scheduling conference at 06-16-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Vincent James Thalman in court by phone from the Milwaukee House of Corrections with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is sworn and testifies to the Petition for Appointment of Attorney.  The petition sent by defendant was not notarized.  Attorney Duffy wishes to withdraw as he has no contact with defendant at all and the defendant has not paid.  Court does not find defendant indigent but because of the large number of cases the court will appoint an attorney at $100.00 per month; first payment due August 1, 2015.   Attorney Duffy had filed a Motion to Withdraw and does not wish to be appointed.  Court authorized Attorney Duffy to withdraw.  Court will find an attorney willing to take appointment.   The defendant may appear by phone but if he is released from the House of Corrections he is responsible to initiate the call.  He is to let the judicial assistant know if he posts bail.  Clerk to send notice of hearing to Mr. Thalman.   Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas W Duffy in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vincent James Thalman in Milwaukee County House of Corrections.  Defendant does not qualify for PD.  Attorney Duffy wishes to be discharged for non-payment.  Court will send Petition for Appointment of Attorney to Mr. Thalman at the House of Corrections 8885 S. 68th Street, Franklin, WI 53132.  Defendant does not object to setting for scheduling conference.  Mr. Duffy does not object if he is appointed by the court to represent Mr. Thalman.  Defendant can appear by phone.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Vincent James Thalman in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Defendant Vincent James Thalman in custody in Milwaukee County Jail by phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Vincent J Thalman in court.  John Martin Yackel appeared on behalf of Bruce Poquette for the State of Wisconsin.
